website_summaries.verdict: A pretty boxed set of 10 water-based oil paints from a top brand – a premium starter set.
pros: Can clean brushes with soap and water quickly and easily
Colors are easy to mix for a wider spectrum of hues
Can be thinned down with water easily
cons: Once paint is down, it could take a while to dry
May be too thick for some and hard to control on canvas

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I loved these water based oils. They are close enough to the normal oils and have a very slight scent of linseed oil which I happen to like as a part of the oil painting experience. I have only tried it on a very small canvas as an experiment and was happy with the results. I would add a quick drying medium just to speed up the drying process next time though.
customer_reviews.author: emily marie orton

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't contain black, but that's okay.
customer_reviews.text: My high school art professor once told me never to use black because it makes the colors less vivid. However, a true beginner might not know this, ergo this is a starter set not a beginner set. In fact, this is the only set you'll need if you know how to mix paint. If you do want black you'll have to buy it separate.
customer_reviews.author: Zan

customer_reviews.title: Eco friendly, simple water and soap cleanup.
customer_reviews.text: Eco-friendly, with its soap and water cleanup, it also mixes well with your standard turpentine to make a luscious paste of sheer color. I found painting with mere water was an unsatisfying experience, but I guess it would work well for those who absolutely cannot tolerate fumes of any kind. I am happy to recommend this paint to anyone, even the 'pros.,' since it will also mix well with standard oil paints though you lose the water cleanup if you use too much regular oils. A great paint line!
customer_reviews.author: emory carroll

customer_reviews.title: A+++
customer_reviews.text: This Paint acts like oil but mixes with water, both of the worlds in painting, don't get dry too fast or too slow , just right for me, great brand and quality !!! A+++
customer_reviews.author: Octavio

customer_reviews.title: but have found them to be quite good! If you're looking for some Oils
customer_reviews.text: Excellent size of oil paints for the price! Everything shipped as promised and I can’t wait to start painting with new paint & brushes! I am a professional artist and oil paints are so experience no matter where you purchase them. These oil tubes were not just a value for my money, but they adhere to the brush and are just as good as any other oil paints, but the other ones are purchased one at a time, you walk out broke! I'm starting a spring painting range either on commission or for myself and I can't want to show & sell! Thank you and will purchase from this seller again! 5 ✨
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Contents not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I would have given 5 stars had the contents not been different than advertised. I bought this set because it is shown to include the water-mixable linseed oil; however, what I got was the water-mixable paint (correct) and brand’s standard (not water mix able) linseed oil, sealed in the package. Kind of defeats the point of being able to use these paints with only water and soap for clean up. Probably manufacturer error. ..I’ll have the get the modified linseed oil separate now.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Work great with Linquin
customer_reviews.text: No complaints does what they are supposed to do. Work great with Linquin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oil paints without the fumes
customer_reviews.text: These water mixable oil paints are a very good substitute for traditional oil painted that thin with turp. I prefer oil paints but wanted to avoid further exposure to the fumes from paint thinners. I'm very happy with these paints!
customer_reviews.author: DianeH

customer_reviews.title: Solid paints!
customer_reviews.text: Grabbed these for some plein air painting on vacation. flight involved so I didnt want to have to deal with finding solvents and disposing of them. All in all the paints seemed pretty good, I dont yet have a feel for water as solvent so I'm not as reflexive with the mixing as I am with trad oils. But aside from that pretty small learning curve they were good. amazon asks to rank as 'giftable' I'd say meh for that unless you know the person like water mixables or if is the first paint they use maybe?
customer_reviews.author: Dan Mahon

customer_reviews.title: A very good set with a variety of colors
customer_reviews.text: A very good set with a variety of colors. I have at least 100 tubes of oil paints that you must use a solvent with to clean the brushes, but wanted to try the water mixable oil paint. It is wonderful to be able to clean brushes in only soap and water.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Heron

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Oil Paint
customer_reviews.text: Watermixable oils are a game changer for me. I work in a very small apartment so I had decided not to work with oils because of the fumes. But these clean up with water. And I use walnut oil as a medium. No problems with toxic fumes now.
customer_reviews.author: Larinda N.

customer_reviews.title: Paints feel very similar to oil based paints to this amateur
customer_reviews.text: I have used WN oils for 25 yrs as amateur dabbling artist. When I needed to set up studio at 2nd home I decided to not haul everything back and forth and to try these water based paints instead. So far so good! Drying time is about the same I have painted over oil based paints without trouble but I am amateur not pro !
customer_reviews.author: Madame D

customer_reviews.title: Great intro to oils.
customer_reviews.text: Just like oils, ... cause they are :) Simple and non-toxic use and clean up. lovely colors.
customer_reviews.author: penny lane

customer_reviews.title: Love the brand
customer_reviews.text: I love the Winsor & Newton brand, its quality paint. The only problem with this kit was it didn't have any black in it. I will definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JAC

customer_reviews.title: I love these as I object to using the solvents
customer_reviews.text: I love these as I object to using the solvents. Water mix and cleanup is as good as it gets. I clean and condition the brushes with Masters soap.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy this paint set
customer_reviews.text: I’ve really been enjoying these paints. If you want to get into oils, but don’t want to have to deal with the harsh chemicals and clean up I would give these a try. I find the quality really great and would recommend them.

customer_reviews.title: great set to start with

And, you will find that it is great oil paints to use........and so easy to clean up after painting. I recommend it for anyone who chooses not to paint with regular oil paints.

customer_reviews.title: Great value.  Give them a try at this price.
customer_reviews.text: I love painting with water mixable oils because we need to avoid solvents in our home. I find them easy to mix, and a breeze to clear up. They do dry quicker that regular oil paints if you use water to thin them. That's a plus for me. I have enough time to blend, work and correct but I can speed up completion. I think theses kits are an excellent value. While I mix paints to create colours, I appreciated the getting the orangey red, cerulean and umber colours that are not in the larger size kits.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: Worth it. They work just like my gouache. They are not hard to work with. Regular oils you need thinners and extra supplies. With these just use a paint brush and water. Colors are vibrant. I will buy a bigger set soon. I attached my first oil painting with them. Edit: found out I shouldn't use them with water. Oh well. Still like them but will use other brand.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Love these water mixable oils
customer_reviews.text: Love these water mixable oils. I discovered these when I was working in an art supply store in California many years ago.

customer_reviews.title: Not as smooth as oils or acrylics
customer_reviews.text: It seems like it would be a good idea -- oil paints that you can thin with water as you work. But the 'texture' of the paints differs from color to color, and they dont spread or blend as easily as either oils or acrylics. Nice idea, but no thanks.

customer_reviews.author: TJones

customer_reviews.title: YES!
customer_reviews.text: Water-based oils - best thing since sliced bread. It's like having it every way you might want it! You can thin it down as much as you want with water to look like either watercolor or thin it less to resemble acrylic. Or you can thin with just a tad of matte medium for a nice thick classic oil effect. I've found that if you thin it with the matte medium it dries faster than if you use water, which is nice as, to me, it tends to dry pretty slowly. This is a very nice set as you can mix these colors to get pretty much any shade you want.
customer_reviews.author: midwestgirl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use producing bright clean colors these paints are ...
customer_reviews.text: Working with regular oil paints caused severe headaches but these water mixable oils do not require thinning with mineral spirits and are totally odorless. Easy to use producing bright clean colors these paints are a delight to use.

customer_reviews.title: Makes using oil paints a simpler and less smellier experience
customer_reviews.text: I’m an artist and love working with acrylics and oils. True oils have a very strong smell and even though they are lovely they gave me a headache. I really liked using these. Much less odor. The linseed oil bottle it came with though does have the same strong scent(as expected). So if you like me have a sensitive nose try getting walnut oil

product_meta.title: Winsor & Newton Artisan Water Mixable Oil Colour Studio Set, Ten 37ml Tubes
product_meta.description: Style Name:Studio SetArtisan Water Mixable Oil Color has been specifically developed to appear and work just like conventional oil color. The key difference between Artisan and conventional oils is its ability to thin and clean up with water. Hazardous solvents are not necessary for Artisan and artists can enjoy a safer painting environment, making it ideal for artists who share a work space, schools or painting at home. Like traditional oil color, Artisan Water Mixable Oil Color is made from linseed oil and safflower oil. The only difference is the linseed oil and safflower oil used in Artisan have been modified so that they will mix and clean up with water. Artisan has been specifically developed to appear and work just like conventional oil depth of color, buttery consistency, light fastness, opacity/transparency, performance and drying times of Artisan, allow artists to use this range for all oil color techniques. This special boxed set contains 10 colors in 1.25 oz. (37 ml) tubes, including one each of Lemon Yellow, Cadmium Yellow Hue, Permanent Alizarin Crimson, Cadmium Red Hue, Cerulean Blue Hue, French Ultramarine, Phthalo Green (Blue Shade), Yellow Ochre, Burnt Umber and Titanium White. Also included is a 2.5 oz. bottle of water mixable linseed oil and 2 long-handled white bristle brushes.
feature_bullets: Specifically developed to appear and work just like conventional oil color
The key difference between Artisan and conventional oils is its ability to thin and clean up with water
Includes 10 colors in 1.25 oz. (37 ml) tubes, a 2.5 oz. bottle of water mixable linseed oil and 2 long-handled white bristle brushes
